title: 110_hr1779
content: Loan forgiveness for Head Start teachers. The section may be cited as the "Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2007." It amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 regarding Head Start teachers who have been employed for 5 consecutive years and meet certain qualifications. The Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2007 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to provide loan forgiveness for Head Start teachers who meet specific qualifications, including demonstrating knowledge in reading, writing, early childhood development, and cognitive learning. Eligibility for loan forgiveness is contingent on receiving a baccalaureate or graduate degree after the enactment of the Act. Authorization of appropriations is also included. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to authorize appropriations for loan repayment for teachers working in qualifying schools for loan cancellation. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to authorize loan repayment for teachers in qualifying schools, including those who have taught in a Head Start program for 5 years and meet specific qualifications related to teaching skills and knowledge. Loan forgiveness under the Higher Education Act of 1965 is extended to individuals who received a baccalaureate or graduate degree after the enactment of the Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2007. Authorization of appropriations is provided for loan repayment for service in qualifying schools. Conforming amendments are made to the FFEL program. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions for loan forgiveness for teachers in their fifth complete program year. Amendments are also made to the Direct Loan Program. Amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965 include changes to loan forgiveness for teachers in their fifth year of teaching. Amendments are also made to the Direct Loan Program.
